201.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
201.title: Registration & Morning Coffee

202.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.
202.title: GDG DevFest Romania 2017 Opening

206.description: Afterparty is a great time to have some fun and meet new people
206.title: Afterparty & Networking

101.description: We will use lots of google cloud tools (firebase, cloud storage, dataproc, dataflow) to analyze our mobile app user's behavior.
101.title: XRay into your user behavior data

121.description: React still continues to dominate a decent chunk of the frontend frameworks space. The team behind it is relentless in moving React forward, thus a new (currently in beta) implementation (complete, fully backwards compatible re-write) of the core algorithm was the next logical step. Fiber is what makes React faster and more powerful. In this talk we are going to take a dive into how Fiber works, how is it different and what can you do to use it and take advantage of the improvements it brings.
121.title: Breaking React apart Fiber by Fiber

102.description: The presentation is about practices and tools for developing an app used by millions of people in multiple countries. It contains tips about choosing technologies, performance, code testing, A/B testing, user testing, app monitoring, release. The key takeaway would be how to tackle both product and technical challenges and release the app without being afraid something will go wrong.
102.title: Android best practices and tools when building for millions

122.description: Build your mobile application easier and with more visual freedom then ever before.
122.title: Flutter.io - new way to build your mobile application with single codebase for Android and iOS.

123.description: In the talk we will review tips, tricks and actual examples of "don’t make me think" UX and of interfaces that wisely manipulate the mental workload in order to help users to achieve their goals.
123.title: Don't Make Me Think!

104.description: Animations are always exciting, in this presentation I'll show how much fun it is to create them with Angular
104.title: Animating with Angular

124.description: Having solid, high quality APIs for your application is crucial and more important than ever especially in today’s microservice architectures. While there are many ways to do it, having a good combination of methodology with a robust infrastructure can really make the difference. During this talk you’ll see how to deploy a Python microservice on the Google Cloud using Connexion (Flask based framework), App Engine Flexible (platform as a service) and Cloud Endpoints (API gateway) following API first principles.
124.title: Going API First on the Google Cloud with Connexion

speakers.bio: Marius Mailat is the founder and chief Android expert at P3 digital services and since 2015 the first Google Developer Expert in Eastern Europe. Marius has a master's degree in Computer Science and has worked in the field of software development for over 18 years. As Chief Technical Officer of P3 digital services, great apps were created in record time and they are still fine examples of workmanship, handmade in Dusseldorf, Belgrade and Cluj-Napoca. He is an active Android trainer a frequent speaker on technical conferences and events. He trained over 500 developers on four continents for companies like Intel, Siemens, Real Networks, Cisco, Garmin and many more.
speakers.name: Marius Mailat
speakers.shortBio: Marius Mailat is the founder and chief Android expert at P3 digital services and since 2015 the first Google Developer Expert in Eastern Europe.
speakers.title: Chief Technology Officer / CEO at P3 digital services

speakers.bio: Vlad is a pragmatic software engineer, Google Developer Expert and an avid caffeine consumer. He loves surrounding himself with ever smiling people and he's constantly pushing his limits in order to become a better professional. He regularly speaks at conferences and meetups where he shares his passion for everything tech related. In March 2017 he founded KRAK3N so he can help clients build amazing products.
speakers.name: Vlad Zelinschi
speakers.shortBio: Vlad is a pragmatic software engineer, Google Developer Expert and an avid caffeine consumer...
speakers.title: Founder

speakers.bio: With a working experience of 20 years, all spent in Information Technology areas, Felix had time to experience many industries in just as many roles. Starting with being a researcher in (quantitative aspects of) social sciences, going to being a developer for "off the shelf" software and later games, to being a solution consultant for major projects in big banks and telecom groups and to architecting and supervising development and operations for the services he co-authored as entrepreneur, services that ended up being market leaders in the territories where they are operated. In the spare time he is also teaching various topics, from fundamental web development techniques to machine learning and big data.
speakers.name: Felix Crisan
speakers.shortBio: Started on zx spectrum, currently on cloud and did everything in between...
speakers.title: Founder & CTO

speakers.bio: Shay Ben-Barak helps companies and startups to identify their users' needs and to cater for these needs relevant product-features with the best User eXperience!  He is running a small design boutique that is focusing on complex systems and on meaningful artifacts. Shay owns a master's degree in Cognitive Engineering from the Technion – Israel Institute of Technology and he is deeply involved in product management and UX design of digital products for almost two decades now. He also teaches UX design in the academy and evangelizes for ethical design practices.
speakers.name: Shay Ben-Barak
speakers.shortBio: Shay Ben-Barak helps companies and startups to identify their users' needs and to cater for these needs relevant product-features with the best User eXperience!  He is running...

speakers.bio: Ciro is Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies, Lead Frontend Engineer at CrossEngage, former contributor to projects like AngularJS, Angular, Angular CLI and Karma. When he's not in the computer or in conferences he's practicing Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.

speakers.shortBio: Ciro is Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies, Lead Frontend Engineer at CrossEngage, former contributor to projects like AngularJS, Angular, Angular CLI and Karma.

speakers.bio: Catalina is a Google Developper Expert with an extensive experience in User Experience, currently being part of the team in charge with creating the best experiences for the world’s famous football game, FIFA. She's currently  part of the team in charge with creating the best experiences for the world’s famous football game, FIFA. Previously, for 2 years, she was the person behind the experience of ING Bank’s internet banking and she also coordinated innovative digital campaigns for 3 years, making ING one of the most loved Romanian brands in social media. Catalina is also a UX trainer, mentor and advocate of design thinking approach. She leads the Women Techmakers Chapter by Google Developers Group in Romania and she is dedicated to developing and supporting the tech communities. She’s driven and curious.
speakers.name: Alina Catalina Banuleasa
speakers.shortBio: Alina has an extensive experience in User Experience, currently being part of the team in charge with creating the best experiences for the world’s famous football game, FIFA...

speakers.bio: Victor is the co-organiser of GDG Bucharest and has been involved in the tech community for over four years. He's a Senior Android Developer, he has built several top apps (either consumer or enterprise oriented) and he also have a long background as a full-stack Java developer. In 2011 he co-founded Mobile Kinetics where they focus exclusively on native mobile applications on all major platforms.

speakers.bio: David is a Software Engineer at Zalando SE and part of the Google Developer Expert (GDE) program for Google Cloud. He is based in Berlin, Germany but he comes originally from Bogotá, Colombia. For the past few years, he has been developing applications for cloud platforms in different kinds of projects ranging from marketing tech to enterprise software to IoT. In his spare time he enjoys travelling, running and cycling.

speakers.bio: Ana is an experienced developer, currently working on the Android Consumer Application at Deliveroo, UK’s fastest growing tech start-up. She is strongly focused on product quality, innovation and continuous learning. Fun fact about Ana: if you check her Deliveroo order history you'll see only sweets and a prawn that she ordered by mistake to a random address before the app was officially launched.

speakers.bio: Tomas is a Google Developer Expert on Google Cloud Platform and Dart. He is a partner in digital agency Multimedia atelier and founder of backend studio fnx.io. He has 20 years of experience in Java development and project management. He has created many successful applications and intends to create a lot more.

speakers.bio: Andrei is a Customer Engineer at Google, helping customers in the CEE region adopt Google Cloud. Past experience include jobs as PreSales Consultant (at Oracle), Software Engineer in various industries (telecom, banking, retail). He also co-started several online projects, like gdocsopen.com (not involved in it anymore) and a few others, including a hardware product, focused on monitoring the indoor air quality.
